intro: Plectritis congesta subsp. brachystemon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-like inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrower leaves and smaller, more compact flower clusters compared to other forms of Plectritis congesta. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. This plant plays a role in supporting pollinators and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
